VI.ii.2.3.h
.
Example:  VA Assigns a 100-Percent Disability Rating to a Non-Severance-Pay Disability
Scenario
:  In a decision on a Veteran’s original claim for benefits, VA awards SC for
a severance-pay disability rated 50-percent disabling, and
a non-severance-pay disability rated 100-percent disabling.
Result
:  VA may
not
withhold any compensation to recoup the Veteran’s disability severance pay while the non-severance-pay disability is rated 100-percent disabling.
Note
:  The result in this example is the same, regardless of whether or not VA assigned the 100-percent rating on a temporary basis under
38 CFR 4.28
,
4.29
, or
4.30
.
